meanings.definition: A person who buys goods or land before others in order to sell them at a higher price.
meanings.sent1: The forestaller purchased all the limited edition toys before anyone else could.
meanings.sent2: The forestaller at the market always had the newest products to sell.
meanings.sent3: The forestaller bought all the ice cream before the hot day, leaving everyone disappointed.
meanings.sent4: She was a forestaller of rare books, always finding hidden gems to sell.
meanings.sent5: The forestaller of concert tickets made a fortune selling them at inflated prices.

meanings.definition: To prevent or hinder by taking action beforehand.
meanings.sent1: He tried to forestall the argument by changing the topic.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to forestall any delays by starting the project early.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to forestall the bird from reaching the feeder first.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to forestall any misunderstandings by clarifying her intentions.
meanings.sent5: The detective hoped to forestall the crime by increasing patrols in the area.
